intro: Saussurea epilobioides, commonly known as the Tibetan fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Asia, including the Himalayas and Tibet. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are usually narrow and grayish-green, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Saussurea epilobioides is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Tibetan medicine.
